website_summaries.verdict: Outperforms other brands to live up to its name – controls odor and dust in a formula that clumps hard in a natural, earth-conserving formula.
pros: Combines wood fibers and corn kernels for an all-natural, dust-free litter
It's lighter than clay litter yet has ultra-absorbency that's ideal for more than one cat
cons: It's expensive compared to other brands, but you get a premium product for the price

website_summaries.verdict: If silica dust is an issue, this is definitely a litter to consider. We also like its instantaneous odor neutralization.
pros: Uses a natural corn-based formula, so no silica dust
Forms tight clumps for easier scooping
Eco-friendly, and safe for septic and sewer systems
Does not use fragrance to mask odors
cons: Natural corn odor may confuse some cats transitioning from clay litters
Does not perform well in warm weather homes

website_summaries.verdict: Well-formed, easy-to-remove clumps and helpful instructions make World's Best Cat Litter a perfect choice for new cat owners.
pros: The World's Best formula is all natural and makes it difficult for cats to track litter throughout your home
The litter is highly absorbent, so even the smallest dribbles form solid clumps
Effectively combats unpleasant cat smells, without any overpowering fragrance in the litter itself
Packaging includes a helpful chart with tips on when and how to change your cat's litter
cons: Litter produces a slight dust when poured from the bag

customer_reviews.title: I used World's Best for years with my previous cat
customer_reviews.text: I used World's Best for years with my previous cat. Odor control was phenomenal. However, two years after he passed away, I adopted a new cat and of course went back to my favorite litter. Something's changed. It's incredibly dusty and the urine smell persists no matter how often I scoop and sanitize the box. As soon as she uses it after a fresh litter change, the whole room smells like urine. I'm super disappointed. I used to recommend this litter to everyone for great clumping and exceptional odor control. The clumps fall apart and odor control is non-existent.
customer_reviews.author: L.A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: grain mites all over
customer_reviews.text: I have been wondering why my cats started refusing this litter and I know now. Grain mites! Millions of them. They are hard to see but all over the places!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsy

customer_reviews.title: Just Awful
customer_reviews.text: This is probably some of the worst cat litter I've ever used. The smell of urine is overpowering yet there's hardly any clumps. Mostly the pee sinks straight to the bottom of the box or falls apart as soon as the scoop touches it. Will be discarding the rest of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Beyst

customer_reviews.title: Dust everywhere - false advertising
customer_reviews.text: Claims to be 99% dust free. I sent a photo of my black cat, Karl, totally covered in dust. I got a response from "World's Best" that they mean free of clay dust, which is false advertising. Dust everywhere - furniture, etc. Finally switched to a different (grass seed) litter & relieved at honest claim of dust free. Cats still getting used to litter & tracks it on the floor, but easy to vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkinator

customer_reviews.title: BUGS BUGS BUGS-add me to the growing list of this problem.
customer_reviews.text: Put this under 5 stars so you can be warned while reading the good review.... used to love this litter but then my apartment became infested with grain mites. they are everywhere and once they get into the kitchen so much gets thrown away. I live in midtown manhattan in a cement highrise so none of these infestations came from outside. its all over my litter box. Company never returned any emails or calls. I returned the last batch to amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Book lover

customer_reviews.title: World's Best Ant Food
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - It's lightweight. - It's easy to scoop. Cons: - It smells funky. - The army of ants invading my cats space now.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M Smylnycky

customer_reviews.title: Horrendous Odor
customer_reviews.text: I really gave this litter a fair chance, because I used it for months. In the end, I discontinued my auto delivery. This is a very smelly litter. It just stinks, even fresh out of the bag. My family just cannot get past the horrendous odor. Also, it tracks horribly. I initially bought this litter in the hopes of less dust and tracking. Sad to say that isn’t the case.
customer_reviews.author: Antoinette

customer_reviews.title: WARNING
customer_reviews.text: Be careful... i left this as a second litter for over flow and after a while of it sitting around, little bugs grew in the litter box!! Turns out the corn byproduct in the litter can cause this. just make sure to throw out the unused... other than that, it works amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: Vitaliy Milke

customer_reviews.title: Not What It Used to Be -- Just a Dusty Mess Now
customer_reviews.text: We've used this product for many years and we liked it. Calling it 99% dust-free was always a little misleading (maybe they go by weight) because it's always been somewhat dusty, but it was bearable, and I'd rather have corn dust than clay dust all over. BUT something has changed, and this stuff is so dusty I'm probably going to abandon it and find something else. Piles of fine dust dominate the contents of the bag, and clouds of it spread everywhere each time I scoop. I thought it might be a one off, but the past 5-6 bags have been awful. Too bad, it was so convenient.
customer_reviews.author: riversurf58

customer_reviews.title: Does not control odor
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 cats, and run 6 litter boxes. I conducted my own experiment by using 6 different litters. The cats avoid this box for the most part. When they do use it, it does control odor and it doesn't clump very well. The litter itself smells like dirt. It's definitely not the best. Arm & Hammer Clump & Seal does the best, but it's also the most expensive one I've used. Tidy Cat RED (Multicat) and Arm & Hammer Multicat are tied for the most affordable options that clump well and control odor.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Shauver

customer_reviews.title: Clumps well but too dusty
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a try because it is so highly rated and I was looking for a more natural, less dusty, scoopable litter. The clumping power of this litter is awesome, it scoops well and overall it’s okay, but it’s still incredibly dusty. You can see the dust in the air when you scoop and my poor black kitties (I have 4) come out with their paws covered in dust. I won’t purchase this again and much prefer the walnut shell litter to this type.
customer_reviews.author: Kris G

customer_reviews.title: It Clumps!  and smells like rotten citrus.
customer_reviews.text: This litter just doesn't work well for smell. The one star is because it clumps fine. But it smells awful, doesn't absorb the cat smell, and my cat hates it. I will put fresh litter in, 2 hours later my cat is complaining and then craps right next to the box. The cat even started doing a thing where he "shops around" the litter boxes in the house. Then settles for right next to the box since they were all filled with this litter. It also smells weird, like rotten citrus fruit.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron S.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Don’t be fooled by the name “Worlds Best Cat Litter”.. this is one of the worst cat litters I have ever purchased. The smell is awful makes me wanna gag and the “99% dust free” claim is a complete lie! This is the dustiest cat litter I’ve ever! There’s is litteraly dust everywhere in and around the litter boxes. I have to cover my mouth and nose when scooping it is absolutely horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Qasim Badshah

customer_reviews.title: Smelled like vomit after a week
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 cats and clean our litter boxes every day (5 boxes) but after having this litter for a little more than a week it just starts to smell sour even though there is no urine or still in it. One of our cats also stopped using the litter boxes when we tried this stuff. Once we switched back to clay based litter she started using the litter box again. I was hopeful about this stuff because of the good reviews and that it's better for the earth but I can't stand my house constantly smelling like vomit.
customer_reviews.author: Clara Wroblewski

customer_reviews.title: Well, FOR ONCE, "the world's best" is actually TRUE.
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying all sorts of kitty litters for the past few years -- expensive, cheap, clumping, non-clumping, clay, paper pellets, sand, some weird blue lightweight chemicals, some weird white lightweight chemicals, but I am happy to say -- DELIGHTED to say! -- that I have finally found an absolutely perfect-in-every-way kitty litter. I "foster" stray cats and kittens, so I have 7 litter boxes in my house, so finding one that actually does what it says it will do, is a real event in our lives......no more ammonia smell, far less mess, no dust, extremely easy cleanup. I wish I could afford to buy it by the TON. And that's no joke!
customer_reviews.author: BOOKSY

customer_reviews.title: Foul Odor, 4 boxes full per bag, cats bite through the bag
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews have mentioned, the used litter smells unusually bad. Even after scooping everything out, the remaining clean looking litter takes on a bad odor after a day or two. I thought one of my cats must be really sick and having extra foul smelling waste...then I remembered the reviews mentioning this litter smelling like vomit after use. Too bad. I like that it's a biodegradable product and slightly less heavy than clay. 1 bag filled our litter box 4 times. The fresh litter smells like fresh grains. Maybe that's why the cats want to eat through the bag. I had to keep it behind closed doors, rather than next to the box.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn A.

customer_reviews.title: Best litter for multiple cats
customer_reviews.text: We've been using World's Best Cat Litter for several years, although we switched to the multiple cats formula more recently when I found out it was available on Subscribe and Save. We had been using the lavender formula prior to switching to the multiple cat formula, and when we switched, it was clear that it was much better with odors than the lavender kind. At one point, we ran out of litter early, and we had to buy the lavender kind since the store was out of the multiple cat formula. Our cats made it very clear that they prefer the multiple cat litter, so after tweaking our Subscribe and Save schedule, we don't run out anymore. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: happyfeet

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cat litter!
customer_reviews.text: Love this cat litter. I have 3 cats, and 2 boxes. It completely gets rid of the ammonia smell of the cat pee. It does not however get rid of poop smell. I scoop every couple days. The litter does clump. After about 2 weeks, it “expires” as I call it, and it starts to smell of urine, so this is when I change out the entire box and put new litter in it. 95% of the time they use one box. The other one they hardly use, I only change the litter every 1-2 months. This litter is also flushable, so if it’s quicker to scoop into the toilet, go for it! I hope this review was helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: It used to be great but now it stinks
customer_reviews.text: The first time I bought this bag I was in love. It absorbs smell so well and I didn't even smell anything in the house and rarely scooped. I used up the whole bag and bought another one. I went back and make sure I ordered the same kind. However there is a drastic difference now. I compared the litter and the texture in sizing is different. It now smells very quickly. It seems they have changed the formula in material and it is not the same high quality product as it was before.
customer_reviews.author: dc lady

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Litter
customer_reviews.text: I switch back and forth between Worlds Best litter and the natural walnut litter. I have cream colored carpet and while the walnut litter does great, the dark color tracks throughout my entire house. The worlds best litter also works great, but is made from corn so its a lighter color. It does not track through the house quite as bad, or rather is less noticeable. It does great at eliminating stinky litter box odors, and I love that its natural. It also doesn't leave the horrible dust that clay litters do. Overall, its an excellent litter choice for any cat home.
customer_reviews.author: SKidwell

customer_reviews.title: Using now since first one came out. THE BEST! 10 STARS!!
customer_reviews.text: After 60 years with indoor cats I feel qualified to speak on this subject. Clumps perfectly to get rid of all used bits. No odor at all. I mean no cat odor at all -- amazing. Standing in the room with two cat boxes you nor anyone I have ever asked could smell cat or cat litter. My two girls love it. Very little dust so everyday vacuum around the boxes takes only two minutes. Lasts longer than any other product I have mistakenly used so get excellent value. Overall 10 STARS. And, if you can beat the price delivered inside my door (25 pounds) then go for it. Otherwise for the best cat litter there is it's WORLD'S BEST!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eral Felder

customer_reviews.title: Trouble with strong odor. :(
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to be able to use a eco-friendly litter. This litter works very well in terms of clumping and my cats liked it, but it develops a very strong odor, not of the cat’s waste, but of the litter itself. It’s a very strong earthy kind of odor, like wet soil. I tried to sift out the clumps and continue to use the remaining litter as instructed. The clean litter (clumps all sifted out) had such a strong odor, I had to completely empty and refill the box at least weekly. This frequency of completely changing out the litter makes this too costly for me. :(
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Odilo OP

customer_reviews.title: good product, if your cat approves
customer_reviews.text: i like this- good woodsy scent, sustainable, minimizes waste- i really like it! two of my cats like it! the third does not. not really odor trapping, so if you scoop less than everyday, you would notice 'eau de chat'. clump power is good enough for my skill set- not set in cement as others might prefer. again, i like it, but my lesson is to buy the smallest bag of any new product,transition, and test with the real focus group before committing to the full size. i now have three boxes with three different litters.... not what i had planned....
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Howe

customer_reviews.title: Really is Worlds Best kitty litter
customer_reviews.text: I discovered this product ~ one year ago. It's the best. No odor, clumps well, it's a natural product so I don't worry about toxins absorbed into my kitties foot pads or from licking them afterwards. It's a little messy, but not bad at all. Highly recommend this product. Plus an added benefit buying from Amazon is that it's delivered to my front door. These bags are HEAVY!! Shopping for litter could not be easier and it's the same price as in the store especially if you are a prime member and don't pay for s/h.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S.

customer_reviews.title: Pricey for what it does.
customer_reviews.text: I like fact that it has less dust. However, it just does not have the clumping ability. The urine breaks apart when scooping, leaving lots of small particles that fall through the scoop. I started mixing it with Fresh Step Scoopable to cut down on the dust. But this is an a more expensive litter...and in the end...its a lot of money out of pocket for litter each month. So I ended up just using the Fresh Step with Febreeze. Which then brings us to odor control. I have tried this and the lavender scent. This scent smells “woodsey”. Not really pleasant when mixed with urine. I prefer the lavender scent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great kitty litter- excellent “clumping” strength!
customer_reviews.text: Just got two new kittens- haven’t had cats for about 13 years- but we have owned up to 6 cats in the past. Wasn’t sure which litter to choose since it had been so long- choose this brand and very impressed. Does a great job of “clumping” pee- and covers poop lightly which helps contain the odor (some)! There is a small amount that ends up outside the box that could probably be contained if I placed a carpet under the litter box. Very little dust. Very impressed overall with this kitty litter.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Great litter! Does not make your room reek of "litter"
customer_reviews.text: I hate the clay litter. I hate the smell, I hate the idea that my cat is breathing in all that crappy dust. The crystals just weird me out and everything else is a hot mess. This litter seems way more natural and unobtrusive. It lasts several weeks before it starts to smell and needs replacing. It is also very absorbent and clumps well. However, it can be a touch crumbly if you don't let it dry a bit before scooping. (If you let it dry a tiny bit it holds together well!)
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Black

customer_reviews.title: Super good cat litter
customer_reviews.text: Super good cat litter. Almost perfect, the only issue is that after it gets stepped on many many times the little chunks break up and form a powder. The powder does get stuck between their toes and come out on the floor as they walk away. You can avoid this by throwing it all out once a week and replacing it with new. I don't do that though, because the odor control is so efficient that I can just add some once a week and never throw it away (of course I scoop out the poop and clumps of pee every day).
customer_reviews.author: Teresa B.

customer_reviews.title: Seriously the BEST
customer_reviews.text: We've tried them all. We have a multi-cat home and keeping the smell down without having a dust tornado during every use is a chore. This stuff is amazing! It keeps the smell down extremely well, clumps better than anything we've ever tried, and can be flushed right down the toilet - what could be better. Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: World's Best Cat Litter!
customer_reviews.text: I've always been skeptical when something is labeled "World's Best", but in this case, I must say it is the best cat litter I have ever tried. I have 4 cats and 4 litter boxes and I have never been happier. It clumps up, doesn't smell and lasts forever! I would recommend this cat litter to anyone out there, especially with multiple cats and those who do not want the odor. I have tried the paper, clumping that gets gummy, corn cob which I thought was the best until now and all the other leading brands. I'm sticking with this one. Thank you for making such a great product.
customer_reviews.author: PaulaK

customer_reviews.title: If this is the worlds best, hate to see the worst
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple cats from working with animal rescues and I was looking for a clumping litter that would be a little better and hopefully last longer than traditional clumping litter. NOPE It claims it will, but in reality it makes a huge , stinky mess. Nothing Ive used in the past stank as bad or as quickly as this stuff which I believe is ground corn product. When you add up the ridiculous cost and the poor performance, I would say keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Coop P

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect! Doesn’t like the scent
customer_reviews.text: This clumps great, is relatively lightweight and controls odor perfectly. I have a open box inside my bedroom and I scoop once a day for both of my cats and it doesn’t smell bad. Tracking is also not too bad since it has larger chunks. My only complaint is the scent of corn husk. I really don’t like it... but you only smell that when really close to the litter box so it is so-far tolerable until I find a better option. So far I have tested grass litter which has a softer texture that my cats liked but the odor control is way inferior to this. Thus I’m sticking to worlds best for now.
customer_reviews.author: Demi

customer_reviews.title: better than any other litter i’ve tried.
customer_reviews.text: this stuff works better than tidy cats or other mass produced brands like that. it smells like hay/cow feed so that’s weird and pretty strong. my male cat will only use it sometimes and then the little bastard craps in the floor if it’s not perfectly clean. he didn’t do that with tidy cats. i’m not switching back though because it doesn’t track *at all* and it’s extremely absorbent. my obstinate male is a baby (just turned 1 this month), so i have faith that he’s not set in his ways and will get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: That this product contains NO chemicals.
customer_reviews.text: THIS CAT LITTER IS THE BEST AS IT IS OF A NATURAL SOURCE (CORN COBS). FOR YEARS I USED CAT LITTER WITH DUST THAT CONTAINED CHEMICALS AND LOST 2 OF MY BELOVED CATS FROM RESPIRATORY ISSUES. I CAN NOT PROVE THE CAT LITTER WAS BAD, BUT I'M NOT WILLING TO TAKE THE CHANCE AGAIN. I HAVE 5 CATS AND 2 LARGE BAGS OF THIS LASTS ME APPROX. 3 WEEKS BEFORE I HAVE TO CHANGE OUT THE BOXES. BECAUSE IT IS NATURAL IT DOES BREAK DOWN AFTER ABOUT 2 WEEKS AND CAUSES A LITTLE DUST, BUT NO WHERE NEAR THE AMOUNT OF THE BRAND I LAST USED.
customer_reviews.author: sms

customer_reviews.title: A more eco friendly choice of cat litter
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this couple months ago trying to be more eco sustainably and stop using clay litter. This is one is made of corn and is clumping, whereas most pine pallets do not clump. It is easy to clean and scoop up. I bought the unscented one because it is always better for the cats. I have to say this is not a cat litter that helps with odor elimination. I also do not flushing this down the toilet because of potential harm to the water system. BUT I still choose to use this for months now because of it being made out of biodegradable ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H.

customer_reviews.title: Gross. Smelly. Dusty. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product two stars because the packaging was really appealing and well made. That’s about the only thing I liked about it. It was extremely dusty litter. Clumping ability minimal. And the smell, oh goodness. It was awful. Unlike any type of litter I have ever experienced for a cat. And we didn’t even use this for multi cat household. We have been using another brand from Costco but wasn’t able to get to the store so we decided to try this from amazon to be shipped to our house. Save your money. I wish I would have
customer_reviews.author: 123AZ

customer_reviews.title: No odor control!
customer_reviews.text: World’s Worst Cat Litter! It has absolutely no odor control. I really think it might amplify the smell if that’s possible! I’m so disappointed because the reviews I read were so positive. I have two cats and even with cleaning the sandbox 2-3 times per day it still reeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Clumping Litter!!! (but smell is a bit odd)
customer_reviews.text: I've tried multiple clumping litters - Arm & Hammer, Tidy Cats, Fresh Step, etc. Those litters didn't form solid clumps, and removing all of the wet litter was a process. This litter makes STRONG clumps, basically making each "spot" of urine a solid brick. It is expensive, but the same volume lasts much longer than other clumping litters that I have tried. Pros: Strong clumps that last, litter lasts longer Cons: Smells odd (not offensive, but not exactly neutral)
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: SMELLY
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy a natural based litter in hopes that it would keep the odor to a minimum. I have to say there is no natural based formula that can mask the typical litter odor. I clean the box twice a day...but it still smells. I have even emptied all of the litter out and put fresh litter but mid-week it smells again. As soon as the litter is moved in anyway the whole room smells of litter. The litter clumps well and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Nat W.

customer_reviews.title: Black Cat? Stay Away from This Litter
customer_reviews.text: I’m start by saying that I’ve been using this litter for about a year now. I have a Litter Robot and it sifts the litter just fine. Urine is absorbed very quickly. However, I recently adopted a black cat and was amazed at the amount of dust that he tracked immediately after going to the bathroom. Be warned, the “99% dust free” label is very misleading. It’s safe to say that I’ll be switching litters... For the amount of money you pay for this litter, it’s just not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but stinks!
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this stuff (it clumps so well!)... but it smells awful. Even right out of the bag, it smells like moldy wood. Once the cats pee on it... UGH. The reason I have stopped buying it is because one of my cats actually refuses to use it. He pees on the floor rather than get in the litter box with this litter. Once I switched back to normal litter, he's using the box again. Can't argue with the customer who's actually using the product, I guess...
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Blennerhassit

customer_reviews.title: My favorite litter!
customer_reviews.text: We had to switch from clay litter after one of my cats had a recurring UTI. This stuff is great! No UTI's since I started using this litter for the kitties about a year ago. I use the Omega Paw litter box and this litter is perfect for that. I have not experienced the bugs in the litter like some others have mentioned. And I think the chart for bag size/cats/time is pretty accurate. The only thing I would suggest is replacing the litter completely every month or so because there is a small build-up of leftover un-clumped litter after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon

customer_reviews.title: Best litter I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: By far the best cat litter I have ever used - And I have tried a lot of them. (Clay-based, silica-based, you name it.) It still tracks through the house, but it is by far the least-trackable of all the litters I've used. The smell is wonderful and long lasting too. I honestly mix this 50/50 with the lavender scented version by the same brand, just to give it a little something extra and it makes the lavender one last me that much longer. Both my cats approve of it too, and they are the ones whose opinion really matters!
customer_reviews.author: Shell

customer_reviews.title: OMG IT STINKS RIGHT OUT OF THE BAG!
customer_reviews.text: out of the bag it smells so awful i don't know what to compare it to....maybe barf. left one pan's worth out for 2.5 days and not one of 6 cats used it. so have no idea if it does the job--had to throw it all away b/c i couldn't bear the stench anymore. the good reviews on this must be fake. what a waste of money. can't imagine trying to return an opened 28 lb bag so, well, that's the price of experimenting and believing reviews.
customer_reviews.author: fern

customer_reviews.title: Petting Zoo Smell
customer_reviews.text: I use to love World's Best. It was my go to for years. Recently I stopped using it and just got back. I have no idea what has changed but I absolutely hate this litter now. The brand new, just opened the bag smell is like a petting zoo. It's so bad my entire apartment smelled like it. Even worse if my cat uses the bathroom at all. I have a genie so cat potty gets scooped immediately, but that smell lingers for hours. It's so bad. Never getting again.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: My cats didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: I decided to switch to this litter from another nin clay that was on subscribe and save called smart cat because I'd be saving about $10 a month.... well none of my cats will use the litter box now and I did add it to the other litter, tried the change over etc. I am switching back to the other cat litter. I found the chunks were sharp and uncomfortable for the cats, there was some dust but there was no odor.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Favaloro

customer_reviews.title: Better now.
customer_reviews.text: My cats hated this at first but after a few trials they are using it fine. I had to edit this review. Definitely read the fine print closely and take your time transitioning them. I use this for cats on toilet training. They didn't like it at first when I switched from regular sand but after putting their feet on it they're doing better. It does smell less and clumps bettre I find. And it flushes better too.
customer_reviews.author: asev

customer_reviews.title: Best Litter EVER! Seriously...
customer_reviews.text: This is The best litter ever! Works wonderfully...no scent(no perfumes & chemicals that could harm the cat and humans), natural, lasts longer because you use less, and no stinky litter box. I highly recommend this litter over All the others...and I've tried a lot of them. Some of the other clumping litters end up getting "muddy" and clay-like when urine saturated it...Not this litter though. It has no scent to it yet it covers the smell of urine and feces completely. My litter box never smells bad...amazingly! I can't say enough great things about The World's Best Litter
customer_reviews.author: MsGulfportGyrl

customer_reviews.title: The name says it all. Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: If you have not tried this pet litter I strongly encourage you to do so. It really is the best litter ever, and I have tried them all, or so it seems. You will have substantially less mess and waste. It clumps and stays together. Great at eliminating order but the absorbency is the amazing part. Everyone i have recommended get this litter has agreed. You will wish you had switched years ago, it really does make that big of a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Walkingthemoon

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: This World's Best Cat Litter is truly the best in our opinion. The red bag that is! I tried the purple bag with the lavender scent and it smelled worst than the cat waste... But, we love the Red Bag of the product because it hides odor and you can't even tell that there is a cat in the house. Clumps up very well and can be flushed if you need it to be. We keep a Litter Genie next to the litter box and that works very well for our purposes of disposal and saves water.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: WORST CAT LITTER EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how people like this litter I only have two kitties and it would not trap any smell my house smelled like poop for 3weeks while I bought a new litter it doesn’t clump it’s dusty my kitties made trails of this litter also they would come out dirty with poop of how it would just not hold the pee or poop in the litter I personally don’t recommend at all and for the price it’s ridiculous how bad it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Santiago

customer_reviews.title: I hope the animal shelter likes it more than I did
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Tidy Cats litter, but it was dusty, so I decided to try something else. This was recommended on several websites, so I gave it a try. PROS: ummm... it's natural CONS: it's VERY dusty my cat is tracking it everywhere it does a halfway decent job of containing odors, but not nearly as well as the Tidy Cats it does a halfway decent job of clumping, but DEFINITELY not as well as the Tidy Cats maybe the green bag is better??
customer_reviews.author: A. K. Whitman

customer_reviews.title: This litter is really the worlds BEST cat litter!
customer_reviews.text: I tried every cat litter on the market and all of them were very disappointing. I didn’t like the higher price point of this product; but I felt hopeless because every other cat litter failed to do what the claimed to do. I was shockingly surprised at how wonderful The worlds best cat litter really is!! No fake perfume smell, and it is light weight, very absorbing and FLUSHABLE! It is the best product by far that I’ve used in my automatic litter box. Also the huge bonus is way less tracking. I also like the lavender scent which is surprising because it is mild But pleasant like diffused high quality oil.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn liberty

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to its name!
customer_reviews.text: This is really is the best cat litter I've ever used (clumping clay, lightweight clay, and crystals). It clumps decently and neutralizes the odor pretty good. I've found the regular and lightweight clumping litter mixed the smell of urine with a perfume-like scent that I hated. With two boy cats, the lightweight litter small granules would track all over the house. The crystal litter works amazing for eliminating the strong male urine (one cat really like it) but since it doesn't clump I didn't like that you couldn't scoop out the soiled litter.
customer_reviews.author: Makai

customer_reviews.title: Scoops well but TERRIBLE odour control - so what's the point? Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: I tried this after my friend recommended it. It scooped perfectly and clumped really well. No pasty smears along the bottom of the litter box, though it did make his paws quite dusty. I really wanted to like it but I couldn't forgive its lack of odour control. After a few days it began to smell, even after scooping. We needed to keep the window open in our (large) bathroom 24/7. We dumped it and tried again. Same thing. Our cat also didn't like it after it started to smell and began to pee in the bath tub instead, luckily he still used it for his other business. Will not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Natty_Louise

customer_reviews.title: Just not the one for odor elimination
customer_reviews.text: I've been on the hunt for good odor elimination being that I have nine cats with seven electronic boxes. Nothing will ever be completely odorless with animals, so I have an exhaust fan and air purifier as well. However, I just found that this litter had a smell that made it worse. It could have been a bad batch of litter, expired bag, or the excess heat in New England; but it just was awful.
customer_reviews.author: kaitlynn ferro

customer_reviews.title: My Go-To Litter - World's Best Cat Litter, Clumping Litter Formula
customer_reviews.text: Much healthier than clay litter. I'm sure to Never pay more than $1.00 per pound for it. I shop around (online) til I find I find the right price. Auto-delivery is great for this product, with a 15% discount and the convenience of not lugging a 28 lb. bag around a store, into then out of the car, and in the house. It's much less work to carry it from the front step into the house. Not to mention, local stores do not sell this it. World's Best Cat Litter, Clumping Litter Formula.
customer_reviews.author: Fiona Finn

customer_reviews.title: Visiting Friends Ask "What Happened To Your Cats?"
customer_reviews.text: When I have friends over, they are amazed that there is no smell. One friend asked if I had gotten rid of them...until the youngest one jumped in her lap. I live in a small apartment with four (yes, 4) cats and a dog. With World's Best, my home smells of brewing coffee and toast, not felines. I am conscientious about scooping, but on the occasions where I've had to skip a day, there is no problem. I also love love love the flushablity. I know that I am not adding to land fill. One thing.....one of my cats is allergic to the lavender scented (it gave him a rash on his back legs), so I use unscented.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Works great in any automatic cat box.
customer_reviews.text: I've been searching for a quality cat litter that absorbs order, moisture and works in an automatic bat box. After trying 5 different products this one is the best. I have 3 cats and this litter does everything it described plus lasts longer between cleanings. I was having to change the litter every three days with other products but with World's Best I only change the box every 10 days.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Garrone

customer_reviews.title: It's true... this is the World's Best Cat Litter!
customer_reviews.text: I am an animal care professional with several cats who all share a common litter box. I switched to this product about 4 years ago and I wish I had of known about it sooner. For starters, it flushable so waste goes down the toilet. Secondly, I actually end up using less litter, so even though it is more expensive than some other popular brands, it ends up saving me a fortune in time and money. And while no cat litter can control odor 100%, this product is better than most. My cats took right to it and are reluctant to use other brands now that they have become accustomed to this litter product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Love this litter, not the packaging it was shipped in
customer_reviews.text: I love this litter. I have two cats and I’ve used this brand for years. The price is so much better through Amazon for the largest bag. The only issue I had this time around is that they squished the 28lb of litter into a box that wasn’t very conducive for the size and the bag ripped. The litter was spilt all over the inside. Amazon was great with response time and resolved my issue though!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: and they're all fantastic. No powdery fumes getting in my cats' (or ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this cat litter for a couple years now, bouncing between different scents (the purple bag - lavender? - is my favorite), and they're all fantastic. No powdery fumes getting in my cats' (or my) lungs and no need to waste several plastic bags full of cat waste per day. I dare say, this stuff makes cleaning your cats' litter boxes enjoyable since it's just so convenient and easy. Every time you clean a litter box with this stuff in it you're reminded of how good a decision it was to buy this stuff. Highly recommended. Get the purple bag if you can; otherwise the red and green are nearly just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Really is the best
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cat litter I've ever used. Whenever my cat deposits some waste into the litter box, the waste is covered immediately and looks like a freshly breaded (uncooked) chicken nugget. I tried the lavender first and it was amazing but I hated the smell. I got the single cat after and it seemed slightly different but still great and it didn't have that smell. I don't know what the difference is supposed to be between the single and multi cat, but the multi cat bag that I got recently had slightly bigger pieces and was a slightly different consistency.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Truly the World's BEST
customer_reviews.text: It took us a while to get used to the non-scented-ness of this litter. It smells like grain, and we mixed in a little scented clumping litter to make it more pleasant at first. This was not a good move. It completely defeated the ability of the litter to clump in it's natural way. I decided to give it a week, all by itself and I am so happy that I did. The odor control of this litter on it's own is amazing. We are going through litter much slower now (saving money) and Gus (the cat) appreciates the freshness of his litter box everyday. Great job guys!
customer_reviews.author: Annie O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This stuff earns its name! It's environmentally friendly, and highly effective! You end up using *way* less of this litter compared to others, and you don't get tiny bits of gravel everywhere, or questionable crystals emitting chemicals into your home. We've been using this brand for every cat we've had since we first discovered it years ago... We don't biy anything else!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to clay
customer_reviews.text: I finally took the plunge and got away from my clumping clay litter. I had a cat with a bad leg and when he peed it caused the litter to stick to his foot. Not good if you’re using clay litter. My neighbor recommended this new litter to me since it’s corn-based and I love it! Clumps and scoops easily. If anyone happens to ingest some of it the body should be able to process it... That’s what I’m hoping at least. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Three stars
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many clumping cat litters, and this litter is not the best. However, I’d say it’s maybe second best... so far. It’s pretty great for the first few days, but then it starts to turn to powder. When it does this, it seems to not clump as quickly, but still clumps quicker then most of the litters I have used. Odor control is decent for a while, clumps quickly, and pretty easy to scoop out.
customer_reviews.author: R.L. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Insects. So many insects.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this litter for years and have loved it. But over the years I’ve been finding more and more insects in my home. Turns out dumping a giant pan of insect food into your home attracts insects, who knew? Now I have an infestation of critters to get rid of. They’re of course mostly concentrated on the litter pan, but they’ve done damage to lots of furniture and gotten into the pantry as well. Bringing this stuff into my house was an expensive mistake.
customer_reviews.author: SecretAsianMan

customer_reviews.title: Came highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t tried it yet, but annoyed that it came busted open. If this is how it typically gets to me, I won’t order any more! This was recommended by a friend so I’m looking forward to trying it.
customer_reviews.author: Hindi Largo

customer_reviews.title: Product Is Fabulous; Shipping Leaves a Lot to be Desired
customer_reviews.text: I love this litter! It is ecologically sourced, easy to use, and my cats use it with ease. I have it on monthly automatic reorder. This month, however, it came without a box, and somewhere in transit it had been sliced open. Someone taped it back together with clear packing tape and sent it through. Not impressed. Up to now service has been fabulous, but if this happens again, I will change where I source this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Bach-Watson

customer_reviews.title: Pricy, but much better than the clay based litters
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if its the world's best litter, but as for my first foray into more natural litters I am thoroughly impressed. It does an admirable job with odors (though it has its own slight smell, which I don't find offensive), has significantly less dust, clumps well, and our cats had no trouble transitioning. It is quite pricy, but at least it does what it purports to do.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kauffman

customer_reviews.title: Great product for 5 cats.
customer_reviews.text: We have 5 cats. This product is fantastic. It absorbs and clumps very well. I like that it is not scented so there is none of the strong smelling perfumed scents. (They do make a lavender scented version if you prefer that). We find the price to be very fair. It is cheaper on here than at stores. We have it on automatic delivery and couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: cuao007

customer_reviews.title: Grows mold quickly
customer_reviews.text: I will say that the clumping of this litter was very good, had minimal tracking as was the great odor control. However, I will never buy this litter again. I have never had another litter that has mold growing in the litter box after only 36 hours from the last scooping. There is very little moisture absorbing capacity with this litter- urine clumps are still moist and pliable- which makes for a perfect environment for mold to grow. This litter is probably better suited as a media for growing organic mushrooms for cooking- if you are looking for an alternative purpose.
customer_reviews.author: BV

customer_reviews.title: Good litter but over priced!
customer_reviews.text: 👽 Unfortunately the World's Best Company has a patent on this formula, hopefully their patent will run out soon so other companies can make the formula, and even better yet, we can get PRIVATE LABEL versions of it through large retailers. One of the nice things about this corn formula, as long as you maintain the proper density in your cat's latrine, you will never need to change the litter which is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Hardin9

customer_reviews.title: World's Best?  I don't know but it's the best litter I'VE ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I have to maintain eight litter boxes and I've tried many many different solutions over the years. I wish I had found WBCL years ago. It's odor and absorbency are far superior to any other litter and it's also less denser (lighter) than most litter. I've had a bad back for years so bending and scooping have always been a problem. I found a sifter built into a garbage can so I can pour a whole litter box into the sifter and reclaim the unused litter. WBCL sifts really quickly and lifting it all is not an issue. Pound for pound WBCL goes farther than other litters.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Healthier Option for the Fur Babies
customer_reviews.text: Great cat litter for multiple indoor cats. Litter is lightweight compared to clay litter, clumps well and if emptied regularly, doesn’t smell. Because it’s non-toxic I don’t worry as much if the cat ingests some while cleaning themselves, like I do when using clay litter. Clay expands - I can’t imagine what it does to their insides. Maybe this product is pricier than clay litter, but it’s worth it to me because it’s better for the “girls.”
customer_reviews.author: Rubeslippr

customer_reviews.title: The smell is so bad!
customer_reviews.text: How did this product get so many positive reviews? It stinks so bad and doesn’t even clump. The entire room smells like this litter and I have to wait for the new litter (Arms and Hammer) to arrive before I can dump that.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase
customer_reviews.text: We recently switched to World's Best Litter after lots of research and recommendations. It is awful! The pieces are smaller than I expected, so they still track out of the box and somewhat beyond the mat. The clumps fall apart at barely a touch when cleaning. There is NO odor control, so the smell is strong even with daily cleanings, and overpowering if a day or two are missed. Last straw was our son telling us last night that there was mold when he was cleaning the box. We have never ever had that issue before. We are looking for a new litter immediately!
customer_reviews.author: G Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: i've tried several and this is the best
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several cat litters and they all break apart, making it difficult to keep the box clean and orderly. This litter lumps together in one piece and doesn't fall apart so you waste less and keep the kitty's place intact. I think they appreciate it. The less expensive litters aren't actually less expensive because it breaks up and I end up trashing more of it. I have three cats and use two boxes and this lasts five weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but terrible smell!!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 04/15/19: I have the litter box inside my room and the smell was so awful I had to throw the hole thing away. Even my cat hated it. Too bad, because it clumps really good!! ——————————— ORIGINAL REVIEW I was looking into another litter for my cat, and came across this one as listed “one of the best litters in the market”. It clumps really well and it’s easy to clean! Since it’s a multicat and I only have one, it lasts longer than others. The only thing is the smell... it’s not pleasant, but I prefer that over the other smells!
customer_reviews.author: Mah Marino

customer_reviews.title: I'm sold. This cat litter is AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: Two indoor cats, two liter boxes and countless litters over the past 11 years, I think we've finally met out match. The multi-cat formula and the lavender scented formula have both provided for our needs. The house never smells like cat box, even if neglected a few days while being away. It lasts. The cats seem to like it just fine. And I've yet to smell the litter boxes since using this product. More expensive up front, but what you get is well worth the money in the end.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Makes smells 100x worse! Kitties don't seem to like it either.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst litter I have ever gotten for my 2 cats. It DOES clump and scoop well but it actually makes the litter smell HORRIBLE! I mean aweful! I can't even describe it! I clean the litter daily and the very first time they use it after I clean it my apartment sticks horribly. Also my cats do not seem to like it because this is the only litter where they have intentionally kicked piles out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Idamouse

customer_reviews.title: I was recommended this litter by my sister
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended this litter by my sister. I love that it doesn't have the chemical litter smell, which I can't take. Previously, I used the pine litter, which I like...for the first few days. However, the pine litter absorbs the smell of the urine, and you never scoop it out, only the poo. This litter does a much better job at keeping my house smelling delightful.
customer_reviews.author: I <3 Books

customer_reviews.title: I love this cat litter normally
customer_reviews.text: I love this cat litter normally...but this AST bag that I ordered from Amazon was not up to snuff. I have read other reviewers not like this product and I never understood why but now I’m beginning to suspect that some of the bags from Amazon aren’t what they should be. I normally order this litter from Chewy but occasionally I do order this from Amazon and I’ve now had two bags from Amazon, not performed as normal. I have no idea if it’s old or what but I don’t think I’ll order this from chewy.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Wet smelly a litter
customer_reviews.text: My cat doesn’t like the litter. After urinating, the clump is so large. He won’t scratch or dig in the litter. and neither will I, so you can’t blame him. I clean out the litter 2x a day.,We never used litter that was so bad, My poor kitty cat. I now have to look fo a different litte. Waste of the me.? My cat dislikes this litter.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie DiCostanzo

customer_reviews.title: Scent, clumping
customer_reviews.text: I liked the clumping, however you did need to be careful it didn’t break apart if you sifted the litter hard. I also liked the absorbency. Odor didn’t seem to be an issue with us either.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle M. Mccormack

customer_reviews.title: doesnt clump like it used to & stinks like pee!
customer_reviews.text: After years of using WBC litter Im so disappointed and annoyed! I dont know what happened to this litter! It doesnt clump like it used to, the room stinks like pee right away after the cats use it & one of my 2 cats hates it so much now that he has started peeing right outside the box or on the door mat near it instead of inside the litter box! Going back to the original formula!
customer_reviews.author: quest

customer_reviews.title: Sadly not the best litter for my cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat is the 20% or so of cats that doesn't like cat nip and for some reason doesn't like the smell of this litter after using it once or twice so he decided to piss in other places around the apartment which defeats the purpose of cat litter. At first i thought it was just the lavender smelling litter same brand and he didn't like that one but the litter clumps well and i was sad he didn't like it so tried the regular and sadly its just the litter in general he cant stand. if your cat is like mine and doesn't like catnip theres a good chance they wont like this litter either.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: I buy 2 every month! I will never use another
customer_reviews.text: I love this litter!!! My husband and I have tried at least 10 other brands and we always have issues with the smell, not clumping or tracking everywhere. I wouldn't buy anything other than the multi cat at this brand even if you only have one cat because it works better than thier regular litter. I have three cats and I love this litter!! Doesnt smell, track and clumps easy. It last quite a while as well
customer_reviews.author: Meena U.

customer_reviews.title: Unscented excellent litter
customer_reviews.text: Really love that I can flush this litter or compost it and I'm not sending clay litter to the landfill. My cats seems to prefer the green regular formula but I find the multicat seems to clump a bit better. The multicat formula is darker and has larger granules than the green bagged version. As long as you scoop the box frequently, we don't find that the odor of cat waste is strong. We prefer unscented to the overpowering odor of scented litter.
customer_reviews.author: Smelly SmingsleyTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Litter everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Man I really tried to like this litter, but my two 10 year old cats track this stuff EVERYWHERE worse than regular grocery store litter. I think it somehow gets stuck in their toe tufts (they are longhairs), so if you have a shorthair with no toe floof, they might not have the same problem. Maybe I picked the wrong color bag but my 2nd bag will be my last... I can't stand having to vacuum every day.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: This litter is truly the worlds best!!
customer_reviews.text: Truly the worlds best litter. We keep the pan next to our toilet and because this litter is made from corn and is completely organic, you can flush it! So no stinky litter pails for us. And talk about easy maintenance. Every time I use the bathroom I scoop the pan so it never sits unattended for long. Clumps VERY well and has decent odor control too.
customer_reviews.author: My3EEEs

customer_reviews.title: Smells bad. I mean, BAD.
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars for ease of scooping without sticking to the box like clay litters. But for me, it doesn’t outweigh the sickening smell. This is one of the worst smells I have ever encountered. Smells like old, wet cigarettes. My cat was pooping and peeing outside of the box when I started using this litter. That being said, it sifts and clumps well when my other cat uses it and it’s not as dusty as other litters.
customer_reviews.author: BumpinLexWifey

customer_reviews.title: Difference of opinion between our cats
customer_reviews.text: Mixed feelings on this. It is the best cat litter I've ever bought. It stays fresh for much longer than other litters and doesn't create a cloud of dust. Unfortunately, one of our cats doesn't like it. She will use it for #1, but then she makes a face, steps out of the box, and deposits #2 about two feet away. And she looks me in the eye all the time she's doing it. Sorry if that's TMI, but when we switched to another litter she returned to the box. I won't give it one star, because our other cat was fine. Suffice to say, we won't be buying any more of this product. Cats rule.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Odor Control? No.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the odor control and it is absolutely terrible. Not only does it linger for hours after you've cleaned it, but it spreads throughout the house. When scooping, everything falls apart, so much for clumping. Only way to get rid of the smell is to dump all the litter and refill. It definitely will not last 60+ days at that rate. I'm not sure if I got a defective bag but I definitely will not be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Loren

customer_reviews.title: No more trash bags with 10+ pounds of dirty cat litter twice a week.
customer_reviews.text: The litter itself smells like paprika, which surprised me. The cats didn't really notice. They just jumped into the litter pan and did their business. Now I just scoop out the "waste", add a little more, and that's it. Once a month, I empty the pan and start over. Easy peasy. And, no, I haven't found any bugs.
customer_reviews.author: auntiepatch

customer_reviews.title: Not Dusty
customer_reviews.text: This is the best we've used so far, its not dusty so we stopped sneezing and coughing after cleaning the litter. I don't think its as clumping as others but I prefer that to being dusty. I feel like this is healthier than others no strong perfume smell and its not really sandy. The only negative thing is that its pricey, other than that its the best for value and health.
customer_reviews.author: peticat

customer_reviews.title: My cats don't like it, sadly.
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good idea. Hardly any dust, good odor control, etc. But my cats do not like it, so they seek <ahem> other opportunities outside the box. I bought 2 28# bags, so it's a standoff, for now. I think I am going to have to get some "usual" litter and mix it in. PS The "balls" of pee are not as solid as regular litter, too. So their friability means crumbs of this material build up in the box.
customer_reviews.author: J. GrayTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: It does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I keep buying it because my cat got used to it, and does not like the consistency of other litters. But I dont like it at all, it says its for multiple cats, well, we only have one, and it still stinks and does not absorve well. I keep finding small pieces of its cloth as I clean it. Not good at all.
customer_reviews.author: JeremyFeddersen

customer_reviews.title: Truly the Worlds Best
customer_reviews.text: Truly the worlds best litter. We have tried so many different kinds. This is by far our favorite. We love that it is toilet friendly and we can scoop and flush. Great product that my cat likes. A+
customer_reviews.author: Crumbysmom
